Name: Head of Shepenwepet the Second, Daughter of Piankhi
Description: Shepenwepet the Second is portrayed wearing the two-feathered crown with two cow's horns surrounding the solar disk. The front of the head is decorated with the uraeus, or cobra, and the vulture which were the divine protector deities of Lower and Upper Egypt. Under her crown the princess wears the Khat headdress, which is decorated with the cobra, the guardian of kingship and royalty. The princess' facial features are perfectly sculpted in this masterpiece of Late Period art.
